title: Prints as process and product in the early Royal Society
content:
Submitted by [Miss Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20071213223411/http:/typophile.com/user/108 "View user profile.") : 8.Oct.2007 11.43am 

===

Friday 19 October, 1pm - 2pm, free

The early Royal Society was much concerned with engraving and  
printing - both as a technical discipline and a practical tool for  
illustration and publication - yet we seem to know little about the  
artists involved, not least with the most enduring images of the  
Society’s early work, the plates from Hooke’s ’Micrographia’.

Speaker: Dr Jim Bennett, Museum of the History of Science, University of Oxford  
Venue: The Royal Society Library, 7 Carlton House Terrace, London, SW1Y 5AG  
To register for this event and guarantee a seat, please email library [at] royalsoc.ac.uk

[http://www.royalsoc.ac.uk/page.asp?tip=1&id=6945](http://web.archive.org/web/20071213223411/http:/www.royalsoc.ac.uk/page.asp?tip=1&id=6945 "http://www.royalsoc.ac.uk/page.asp?tip=1&id=6945")

===
author: Miss Tiffany
